title: Smart tips on post-sex hygiene
text:

You have just had a highly satisfactory lovemaking session, complete with earth-shattering orgasms. After all, you and your partner are conversant with every trick in the book that promises to make your sex life spicier! All that's fine, but what about post-sex hygiene rituals? If you are still clueless about what we are talking about, here are some expert-backed tips to help you out:Experts recommend a thorough genital wash after intercourse for both partners. But avoid vigorous cleaning with harsh lotions. Avoid vaginal douching (for instance, introducing a stream of water to clean out the vagina) as well. Several female hygiene products are available in the market these days. Medical experts say one should opt for only those products that contain lactic acid, which prevents bad bacteria from taking over.You must have been told time and again that urinating after intercourse is a wonderful way of warding off urinary tract infections or UTIs and other unpleasantness down there. Well, doctors agree. “The female urethra is very short compared to the male part. So rubbing and other movements during sexual intercourse can cause ascending urinary infection,” says Dr Sushmita Mitra, a Kolkata-based gynaecologist. “Hence, urinating after intercourse can minimise such unpleasant infections,” she stresses.This should be a rule - drinking water after a vigorous romp. Just as we are told to sip water after a rigorous workout at a gym. Doctors say that a hydration ritual post sex can rejuvenate the whole body. It is also believed that drinking water after sex can help in flushing out UTI-causing bacteria.
description: To keep infections at bay, follow these expert-backed recommendations regarding post-sex hygiene. Thank us later!
